intro: Weinmannia cochlearis, commonly known as the spiral tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Weinmanniaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California and northern Baja California, where it thrives in sandy soils and coastal climates. The plant is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting various pollinators. Weinmannia cochlearis is often found growing in coastal chaparral and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
